column4: I am using gigabyte VIA/S3G UniChrome Pro IGP board and 8.10 does not complete the boot from cd or installation. Can some one help
I am using gigabyte VIA/S3G UniChrome Pro IGP board and 8.10 does not complete the boot from cd or installation. Can some one help, please?
at the boot screen, press F6 and delete the following words from the sequence: quiet splash
you need to read what it says and decide from there.
it sounds like you have a bad video driver
what video card do you have?
I downloaded the Linux mint and the same problem came up. they boot fine in safe graphics mode but then i cannot change resolution later
then you have a hardware problem.
the display driver in windows is  VIA/S3G UniChrome Pro IGP. It works fine in Linux with ubuntu 8.04 or linux mint 5 but not with 8.10 etc
i see. you can try changing the display driver from S3 to VESA when it boots to safe graphics mode
can u give me a bit of guidance on that
when ubuntu starts, does it give you the option of booting into single-user mode?
perhaps so, I can check later when i boot in there. I know i have to fill in user name and password
sounds good. you may also want to read and bookmark this page: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=342115
I looked at the page. Thanks a lot. My mother board is Gigabyte K8M800 which is mentioned there. however I dont understand the change of settings. Can u please help with xorg etc
once you are able to boot the system into single-user mode, you will be able to change the /etc/X11/xorg.conf then
